FuncDef: The display l2tp session rui command displays L2TP session backup statistics.
CLIs: display l2tp session rui [ [ tunnel-item <tunnel-id> ] session-item <session-id> | source-ip <source-ip-address> | destination-ip <destination-ip-address> | bas-interface { <if-name> | <if-type> <if-number> } | remote-backup-profile <rbp-name> | remote-backup-service <rbs-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a local tunnel index.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

Displays L2TP session information with a specified session ID.
-

Specifies the local ID of an L2TP session.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.

Displays information about an L2TP tunnel session with a specified source IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about an L2TP tunnel session with a specified destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal format.

Displays information about a tunnel that is set up using information about a user accessing a specified interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 50 characters.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Displays the name of remote backup profile.
The value is a string of 1 to 128  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays the name of  remote backup service.
The value is a string of 1 to 32  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: LTID: local assigned tunnel ID , RTID: Remote assigned tunnel ID
LSID: local assigned session ID , RSID: Remote assigned session ID
RG: Register(L:local,R:remote), FWS: Forwarding state(L:local interface, P:protect path).
LSID  RSID  LTID  RTID  UserID  UserName          RG state    Life        FWS
ExtraInfo: The display l2tp session rui command displays L2TP session backup information including backup parameters in the L2TP dual-system hot backup scenario. Dual-system hot backup parameters of L2TP sessions that are not backed up will not be displayed.
